olympia.name: Hands on Children's Museum
olympia.description: Center offering participatory exhibits & programs on art & science for kids.

olympia.name: Ape Cave
olympia.description: The third longest lava tube in Northern America stretching 2 miles long with an easier lower cave, and the challenging upper cave.

olympia.name: Squaxin Park
olympia.address: 2600 East Bay Drive Northeast, Olympia, WA 98506
olympia.description: Squaxin Park is a public park located in Olympia, Washington. Established in 1905, it was the city's first waterfront park, providing access to the Budd Inlet of Puget Sound.

olympia.name: Tolmie State Park
olympia.description: A 105-acre marine park where there is a large beach good for exploring and a artical reef that is popular with divers

olympia.name: Millersylvania State Park
olympia.description: A large lake campground with fishing, boating, and hiking in a old forest

olympia.name: WET Science Center
olympia.description: Hands on activities teaching kids about the water cycle & water's vital impact on life on earth.

olympia.name: Billy Frank Jr. Nisqually National Wildlife Refuge
olympia.address: 100 Brown Farm Rd NE, Olympia, WA 98516
olympia.description: A freshwater wildlife preserve with amazing views

olympia.name: Mt. St. Helens
olympia.address: 3029 Spirit Lake Hwy, Castle Rock, WA 98611
olympia.description: A active volcano with ongoing volcanic activity with an major eruption in the 1980's with many attractions surronding it, and many hikes a great place to go.
